page.title: 15RELIGION
page.content: Pilgrim's Hall is situated on the Ongar Road, Pilgrims Hatch. It is a Regency-style mansion, set in 20 acres of parkland. It is a Christian Training Centre for the Lamb of God Community, an ecumenical organisation, financed by a registered charity. The trust purchased the house in 1968 for Â£30,000 and divided it into flats. Much of the farmland is rented out, but some is farmed by the community itself. Between 1843 and 1860 it was known as Pilgrims Hall Academy, a boys boarding school for commercial and upper-middle class families. More about Pilgrims Hall can be found in 'The Private Life of a Country House' 1912-1939 by Lesley Lewis, a member of the family who lived there.
